captions.text:
That's not going to work
on me this time, sweetie.

Heavenly Father, we
thank Thee for this day.
We thank Thee for our family.

Please help us to be able to
get done all the things that we

need to do today,
and please help

us to get to school on time and
to not fight with each other.
And help us to be safe.

I'm sorry to ask, but I have to
go to a doctor's appointment,

and I was wondering if there's
any way you could watch
Millie for just a couple hours.

Have you asked anyone else, like
Brooke or Crystal, or anyone?

We're headed out
the door right now.
I have, but I can call around.

I have some stuff to do around
the house, so it works out.
No, no, no, no, no, no.
Didn't they just have a baby?

My guess is, we don't
need a manager like that.

Just give me what I
need to do my job,
and I will make you look good.
So what are you going to do?

Everybody's looking
at me to help them.

I don't want to stay
there if I'm not happy,

but at the same time, I
don't want to abandon them.

I really just want to think
about myself, but I can't.

I don't want to bother
you with it, though.

If you left, who else
would be able to help them?
It's left over from last night.
Do not put grass in your mouth!

Jessica's going to
be here any minute.
Well, I'm so sorry it's late.

Emily will say she's
brushed her teeth,

but I usually have
to do a breath check.

I mean, you don't have
to do that, but just

make sure you have
William actually

Aurora, what do
you want to play?

You want--you want to
play a game, don't you?

Looks like my
plans have changed.

We're not going to need you
anymore tonight, Jessica.

Dear Heavenly Father, we
thank Thee for this day.

We thank You for all
our many blessings.

Thank Thee that I
won the science fair.

Thank Thee that we could
get all the things done
that You needed us to do today.

Thank Thee for
Grandma and Grandpa.

Thank Thee that we could
have a good day today.

Many of you think
you are failures.

You feel you cannot do well,
that with all of your effort it

We all worry about
our performance.
We all wish we could do better.

But unfortunately
we do not realize,

we do not often see the results
that come of what we do.

You never know how
much good you do.

Thank Thee for all
our many blessings,

in the name of
Jesus Christ, amen.

title: You Never Know How Much Good You Do

comments.author: MaryJ. E Alohan.E.

comments.text:
I am a single mother right now. I am battling to get back to church because 
it conflicts with one of my jobs. My husband was deported to Mexico because 
of an expired visa and down in Mexico he self medicated himself with 
adventure and then cleaned up and got baptized. However one day he told me 
that he did not love me the same anymore. And that was when I just knew in 
my heart there was someone else for him. We have a four year old boy who is 
adhd and I struggle everyday with college, keeping him calm, and here 
recently with my faith. I feel like things are never going to get better, 
although I know one day they will. I am exactly like this woman in the 
video. I never say no to nobody and I always aim to make people happy. I 
realize now that even something as simple as prayer can begin to give me 
hope for a better change in mine and my sons life﻿
comments.author: Lynnette Ceron

comments.text: Love this 💗﻿
comments.author: Karrie B

comments.text:
Check out her to-do list: "Return shoes", "take photos for blog", "call 
babysitter", "replace drawer pulls", "sew William's scout patches", "delete 
FB account", "thank you card to Jill", "take dinner to Carroways" -- only 2 
of those things had to be done that day, and could've easily been done in 5 
minutes with a call to a pizza place. She had 7 hours of school-day minus 3 
hours of service to do what she wanted/needed to do. (Of course moms with 
small children never get much of a break...)

The big problem is that the unusual number of pop-up demands messed up her 
visit with her cousin. =( 

As a husband of a wife who does the same kinds of things, 3 in one day is 
not normal. I hate to see people interpret this as the church encouraging 
people to be slaves to others' problems. 

Instead I see a beautiful family having an unusually hard day that reveals 
how well set their hearts and priorities are. My heart goes out to this 
(fictional) mom and all the real ones who make the same choices. 

﻿

comments.author: Mr. Bumble

comments.text:
I am not Mormon, but a friend shared this video. I thought it was 
excellent, and it did fit the message at the end. In the video, there is a 
constant reminders of the to-do list, and the messy house with chores that 
don't seem to get done. You see a view of mom that gives her time to 
others, and doesn't see the benefit. In the end, when you see her list, she 
only got two things done, and she didn't get to see her cousin. You would 
think that the day was a failure.

But when her son says, "Thank Thee that you allowed us to get all things 
done that You needed us to do today," the mom realized that the things she 
accomplished in that day were not what she wanted to do on her to-do list, 
but what God needed her to do for that day. She helped her son win the 
Science Fair, she helped her sister make a decision in life, she helped a 
friend who was struggling with bad news, and she helped a new family get a 
nourishing meal for the night.

The speaker's voice summed up the point. When we serve others, we should 
never feel like we have failed, or that our performance is lacking, because 
we cannot be aware of all the good that we do on His behalf. And also being 
thankful for what you do have despite missing out on things we really want.﻿
comments.author: ganthc

comments.text:
If the Holy Spirit whispers to a woman that she needs to stop what she is 
presently doing and help someone, regardless of what is happening with her 
stay at home children, she needs to obey. Our personal beliefs and 
scriptural interpretations can never "trump" or override a divine mandate. 
Jesus Christ is the Ultimate example of putting all else to the side and 
SACRIFICING ALL that HE had and was to save us!  I am amazed at how many 
people CLAIM to be Christian, but have absolutely no idea what "Christian" 
means. It means doing things as Jesus Christ would do. Jesus said, "I came 
to do the will of my Father, not to do MY will!"﻿

As we go our separate ways for the Thanksgiving break, we thought we would 
take an opportunity to express our deepest gratitude for the countless ways 
that you lift and serve, often when it is inconvenient, and sometimes when 
you feel you have little left to give. Most of you have seen this little 
video You Never Know, which captures how we feel about each and every one 
of you. The good that you do so beautifully and dramatically outweighs your 
imperfections, even if you can’t see it sometimes. We see it! #ahsutah﻿

own life. This has been hard for me because I used to criticize more, Now I

comments.author: Jennifer Kuiper

comments.text:
Thank you Camilla for your opinion. I, too, was NOT touched by this video. 
It miss-represents women in the Mormon Culture and some of basic LDS 
Beliefs. We believe is serving with a willing heart as best as we are able. 
Sometimes it is very difficult to serve and we can be encourage to serve 
even when it is difficult, but we also have to be aware of our own limits 
and needs. God wants us to have and feel JOY!

FIRST-we believe in FAMILYS and building strong healthy family 
relationships. (This include children & cousins & sisters). Helping her 
children, lunch with sister, and meeting with cousin were all very 
important events that day.

SECOND-A Relief Society President would be hard pressed to ask a single mom 
with three kids to make dinner for a young married couple who just had a 
baby with only a couple hours notice. This arrangement in the church is 
most often done with prior arrangements by those who volunteer. Especially 
when the new father was enjoying his meal while the main character in this 
video was at home crying and depressed. There are many willing hands in 
the LDS Church and if someone has prior appointments or obligations we can 
easily find an alternative. (This was not accurately represented in this 
video) Same as with the sister who needed a sitter last minute-There are 
many willing sisters in our community that can help. The church has an 
inspired program called The Visiting Teaching Program, where all sisters in 
the ward have two other sisters who visit with them regularly. Very often a 
sister in need can call on her visiting teachers first to see if they can 
help. AND in an unannounced way they willingly help their sisters. (I wish 
a Mormon message was made about this, because it happens all the time and 
truly reflects LDS sisters serving women on a regular basis)

THIRD-This women represented the whole idea that "Women who think they can 
do everything that is asked of them without consideration of their own 
needs will end up depressed and resent the whole aspect of service"....I 
doubt that President Hinckley would appreciate his quote used to encourage 
women to say yes to everything and ignore their own needs.

FOURTH-Yes.....she did good by helping others but with a depleted depressed 
attitude-This does not bring JOY in our lives and we do not preach this 
concept to our women.     AND if each of the people she helped knew the 
pain and sorrow that was the end results, and that she missed a most 
important joyful reunion with a cousin, then they probably would not have 
felt so great themselves.  AND what about the poor cousin who got 
forgotten?  We don't encourage our members to make appointments and then 
not show up!

If you want to know more, go to LDS.org and go to the Resources page and 
look up Relief Society. There will be messages and videos of what the LDS 
church teaches it's members.﻿
comments.author: TL Greg

comments.text:

bunch of housework and other heavy demands. It was to show that even when 
you think your efforts aren't good enough, really it makes a bigger impact

comments.text:
Words can not express how much I enjoy this video. It has such a great 
message. You never know how one simple act of kindness can effect others 
around you or how they may simplify somebody else's trials. If you can be 
that kind person to lend a helping hand, then be that person. If you find 
yourself being that person who could use a helping hand, kneel. Pray. Let 
the Lord do his work for you and good things will come your way. God loves 
all his children, even those who aren't living on a path of righteousness. 
We all can experience God's love, whether it may be through prayer or 
through service or through a simple act of kindness. Just believe in the 
power of prayer and witness those miracles that follow.﻿
comments.author: Amanda Burns

comments.text:
Thanks, I have seen this video before but it really hit home and helped me 
tonight. People don't always value the little things that pile up on us, 
that we do to keep things moving, and sometimes what we think we should be 
doing gets completely pushed aside. We just need to pray for strength that 
the things we manage to do are the ones the Lord wants us to achieve and 
trust that he is guiding us in our hearts.﻿

comments.author: Joe Rentteria

comments.text:
Is this the life we bequeath to our daughters? Or do we teach them to find 
peace and joy in a day that offers them some time to nurture themselves 
too?  Words from a general authority from time to time do not compensate 
for a life lived totally for the (sometimes selfish) needs of others.  Get 
some balance, and put yourself in the equation. Tell the Carraways to call 
in a pizza for heavens sake! Why did her neighbor wait until the last 
minute to deal with a doctor's appointment? A day like this happens to 
everyone once in a while, but this kind of life needs to be prayerfully 
re-thought. ﻿

comments.author: Johnny Bloggs

comments.text:
Sad video, and sadder still all the women who love and resonate with it. 
When my activity in church or life looks like this, I do not feel empowered 
or joyful--I feel discouraged and weak, and I know that I have need to 
repent and better listen to the spirit which brings joy and love and 
teaches me not to lie to my children, not to fail in commitments to 
friends, not to do things out of pressure, guilt, fear of what others will 
think, or false obligation. Christian service is centered in joy; it 
magnifies and expands us. Never did this mother pause and pray for 
inspiration to know what to do. If she had she would have received 
inspiration about what commitments to make, and wonderful joyful insights 
about how to help and serve in ways that also edified her, and she would 
have her angels helping her (so she wouldn't forget about the dinner, and 
then forget to turn the oven on, etc.) She was not acting in the power of 
the Lord, she was acting in her own weakness. Sure, God can make good out 
of even the worst days and the worst choices we make. But sending the 
message that the behavior this woman displayed in this video is Godly or 
something to be admired is false. Women can be so much better than this, 
and they need to know that. Please do not validate this kind of false 
martyrdom. Please instead show messages of women truly acting in the power 
of God, filled with revelation, love, joy, integrity, and personal 
strength. Those are the kind of women the Lord needs.﻿
comments.author: Michelle Stone

comments.text: Check out this video on YouTube:﻿
comments.author: lilg Fuentes

comments.text: It was good to hear president Hinckley's voice again. Thank you! ﻿
comments.author: Zane Bouck

comments.text:
This left me really sad and hoping women in the church don't feel like this 
is what's expected of us-to let ourselves be run ragged and do anything 
anyone asks no matter how last minute, and to feel miserable at the end of 
the day because everything was taken care of except for our own needs. I 
think a better end to this video (even though I adore President Hinckley) 
may have been: "It is a strength for women to be able to cross their own 
boundaries easily when they are meeting the needs of their children and 
serving others, but it is a great disadvantage when they feel every call 
for service as an imperative which they are obligated to meet. Remember, a 
boundary has “yes” on one side and “no” on the other. A woman who never 
feels that she can say “no” is lacking an important element of personal 
identity and, hence, personal safety.” -Chieko Okazaki﻿
comments.author: Angi Klein

comments.author: elesha burgess

comments.text:
Well, apparently liking this video is part of the minority. People, do we 
have to look at the negatives here? Why can't we just enjoy the peaceful 
message that comes from this video? I understand the concerns of others 
that this might be teaching people to "give of themselves relentlessly" but 
I highly doubt that's what people will learn from it. I don't think the 
Church is saying, "Hey, this is what women should do," as much as they are 
saying, "Hey, this seems to be what women already do and we want them to 
know they're awesome." As a college student, constantly running from place 
to place with sometimes what feels like 0 free time, I question if I'm 
doing what the Savior would have me do and THIS video comforted me 
incredibly.﻿
comments.author: CollabMusic
